text: szbyr v minister for immigration and citizenship  immigration
refugees
the appellants were refused a visa under s 36(2) of the migration act 1958 (cth) ("the act ")
the appellants gave a statutory declaration to the refugee review tribunal ("the tribunal")
the tribunal affirmed the decision not to grant a visa partly on the basis of discrepancies between the statutory declaration and the appellants' oral evidence
whether relief was available to the appellants.  immigration
refugees
s 424a of the act , read with s 441a , requires that an applicant be given written notice of particulars of any information that would be a reason or a part of the reason for affirming a decision
